item.title: Book Review: Tensors and Group Theory for Physicists (Jeevanjee)
item.author: Jim Kennington
item.description: Summary I picked up a copy of Nadir Jeevnajee’s An Introduction to Tensors and Group Theory for Physicists a few months ago with the intent of skimming through and spending most of my time in reference texts. To my pleasant surprise, I found this text to be self contained - requiring little to no references. The presentation is at once mathematically rigorous and physically intuitive, alluding to well-known examples from physics throughout.
